section.heading: Public awareness campaign and violation tip line.

para.text: No later than 180 days after October 1, 2020, the Mayor shall launch a public-education campaign to raise awareness and educate the public about the rights of tipped workers pursuant to subchapter I of Chapter 10 of this title, Chapter 13 of this title, and subchapter III of Chapter 5 of this title.

All materials prepared and distributed in accordance with this subsection must contain a telephone number and internet website address for the Department of Employment Services and the Office of the Attorney General where an employee can obtain additional information about the employee's workplace rights or file a complaint.

The campaign shall include the preparation of written materials, available in concise physical format, that state in plain language the rights of tipped workers under the laws identified in paragraph (1) of this subsection.

The campaign shall place particular emphasis on communities that are most at risk for wage and labor violations and shall publicize resources available to tipped workers to protect against wage theft.
The Mayor shall distribute such materials to all workplaces that employ employees paid pursuant to § 32-1003(f), and employers shall distribute the materials to all employees.
The campaign shall comply with subchapter II of Chapter 19 of Title 2.

The Mayor shall create a reporting system that permits the public to report violations of subchapter X-A of Chapter 2 of Title 2, subchapter III of Chapter 5 of this title, subchapter I of Chapter 10 of this title, and Chapter 13 of this title.
Be accessible to the public by the Internet and telephone 24 hours each day and 7 days each week for the entire calendar year;
Have live staff available to take complaints, answer basic questions, and provide resources during business hours; and
During non-business hours, have a voice-messaging system available on which an individual may leave his or her contact information so that his or her message can be returned;

Be user-friendly, including the ability to be accessed and viewed via mobile devices such as smartphones, to enable an employee to easily report an alleged violation of the laws identified in paragraph (1) of this subsection; and
Include video tutorials on how to report alleged violations of the laws identified in paragraph (1) of this subsection;
Comply with subchapter II of Chapter 19 of Title 2[;] and
The Mayor shall review all reports collected on the reporting system on a weekly basis.
The Mayor may investigate whether violations reported through the reporting system established by this subsection have occurred.
